official-title.#text:
Expressing the sense of the House of
		  Representatives that the Citizens’ Stamp Advisory Committee, as an entity of
		  the United States Postal Service, should issue a commemorative stamp in honor
		  of the holiday of Diwali.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Oversight and Government
			 Reform

sponsor.#text:
Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New
			 York

term.#tail:
, is an Indian holiday that also marks the beginning of the Hindu

text.#text: Whereas Diwali, also referred to as the

Whereas the holiday of Diwali is observed in America, and
			 across the globe, by Hindus, Sikhs, Christians, Jains, and Buddhists;

Whereas the practice of Diwali has survived political,
			 economic and social changes throughout history, while always carrying the
			 universal symbolism of the victory of light, goodness, knowledge, and
			 truth;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

			 stamp in honor of the holiday of Diwali; and

text.#text:
Whereas issuing a postage stamp honoring the holiday of
